intro: Ochreinauclea missionis, commonly known as the Mission's ochre acacia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow to orange flowers. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insect species.
